metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3802 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: A vulnerability found in udisks2. This flaw allows an attacker to input a specially crafted image file/USB leading to kernel panic. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

criterions.comment: udisks2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
